marketNews.title: US Job Growth Slows, Expectations of Fed Rate Cuts Rise
marketNews.content:
US job growth slowed in June 2024. Non‑farm payrolls fell to 206,000 jobs, down from the revised May 2024 level of 218,000, yet still above the consensus expectation of 190,000. The April 2024 non‑farm payroll figure was revised down by 57,000 to 108,000 jobs, and the May figure was revised down by 54,000, indicating that the US labour market is not as strong as previously thought. The unemployment rate rose to 4.1% in June (versus 4.0% in May), above the consensus forecast of 4.0% and marking the highest level since November 2021.

Following the data release, the three major US equity indices rose on Friday (5 July): the Dow Jones increased by 0.17%, the S&P 500 rose 0.54%, and the Nasdaq gained 0.9%. The 10‑year US Treasury yield fell 6.9 basis points to 4.278%, while the US dollar index (DXY) slipped 0.24% to 104.88.

The slowdown in US job absorption lifted market expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut in September 2024 to 68.2% on Monday (8 July), according to the CME FedWatch Tool, up from 59.8% on 1 July 2024.

In Indonesia, the rupiah appreciated 0.3% to 16,265 per US dollar on Monday (8 July). The 10‑year Indonesian government bond yield fell 3.6 basis points to 7.03%. The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) was essentially flat, slipping 0.03%.

Key Takeaway: The slight dip in the IHSG on Monday (8 July) does not reflect a weakening risk appetite, as the number of advancing stocks (318) outnumbered decliners (256) and unchanged stocks (223), and most sectoral indices were positive. Optimism was also evident from the strong gains in cyclical sectors such as property, technology, and construction.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Announces Consumer Confidence Index Decline
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia announced that the Consumer Confidence Index fell to 123.3 in June 2024, down from 125.2 in May. The decline was driven by a drop in almost all sub‑indices except the current‑income sub‑index.

marketNews.title: Labor Ministry Reports Increase in Layoffs and Informal Employment Rise
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Manpower reported that the number of layoffs (PHK) during the first five months of 2024 reached 69,472, higher than the full‑year totals of 64,855 in 2023 and 25,114 in 2022. The share of informal workers rose from 55.72% in August 2019 to 59.17% in February 2024, while the share of formal workers fell from 44.28% to 40.83% over the same period. Business reported that entrepreneurs do not deny a formal‑worker crisis caused by insufficient state support for labour‑intensive sectors.

marketNews.title: Finance Ministry Coordinates Review of Import Tariff Rates
marketNews.content: The Head of the Fiscal Policy Agency of the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, said the agency is coordinating with the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of Trade to determine the level of import duty rates. Meanwhile, Trade Minister Zulkifli Hasan said that almost all ready‑made imported goods will face duties above 100%, including cosmetics, footwear, ready‑made garments, textiles and ceramics.

marketNews.title: Trade Ministry Announces Upcoming Cooking Oil Retail Price Increase and DMO Change
marketNews.content: Trade Ministry Director Bambang Wisnubroto said the highest retail price (HET) for cooking oil will be announced next week. Previously, Minister Zulkifli Hasan had indicated that the HET for cooking oil would rise from IDR 14,000 per litre to IDR 15,700 per litre. In addition, the government will amend the domestic market obligation (DMO) rule so that only cooking oil (Minyakita) will be covered, eliminating the previous DMO for bulk cooking oil.

marketNews.title: Rice Production Forecast Shows Decline for 8M24
marketNews.content: The Central Statistics Agency’s May 2024 sample area forecast predicts that national rice production for the first eight months of 2024 will fall 9.52% year‑on‑year to 21.39 million tonnes, with a projected surplus of 0.82 million tonnes. The estimate is based on an expected 9.54% year‑on‑year decline in milled paddy and a projected 7.52% year‑on‑year reduction in harvested area to 7.24 million hectares.

marketNews.title: Coal Benchmark Price Formula Considered Reflective of Market, Review Underway
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Mining Experts Association, Rizal Kasli, assessed that the current Coal Benchmark Price (HBA) formula reflects market prices because it is based on the weighted average of the previous month. Last week, Acting Director‑General of Mineral and Coal (ESDM), Bambang Suswantono, said the government is reviewing the HBA and the royalty rate for Special Mining Business License (IUPK) holders.

marketNews.title: U.S. Department of Justice Announces Boeing Guilty Plea and $243.6 Million Fine
marketNews.content: The U.S. Department of Justice announced that Boeing (NYSE: BA) has agreed to plead guilty to criminal fraud conspiracy charges and will pay a $243.6 million fine to resolve the investigation into the two fatal 737 MAX crashes in Indonesia and Ethiopia in 2018 and 2019. By pleading guilty, Boeing will avoid a criminal trial that had been strongly urged by the victims’ families.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Cancels Acquisition of Bank Muamalat, Eyes Victoria Syariah
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) Chief Executive Officer Nixon Napitupulu said on Monday (8 July) that the bank cancelled its plan to acquire PT Bank Muamalat Tbk. He did not give detailed reasons, but Katadata reported that the acquisition failed because Bank Muamalat’s due‑diligence results were unsatisfactory. Katadata also reported that BBTN is reconsidering the acquisition of PT Bank Victoria Syariah, an entity owned 80.2% by Victoria Investama (VICO) and 19.8% by Bank Victoria International (BVIC). The BBTN acquisition plan is part of the group’s strategy to spin off its sharia‑banking unit, BTN Syariah.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Launches New Mobile‑Banking App "Wondr"
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) announced the launch of its new mobile‑banking application, Wondr by BNI. The application will replace the current BNI Mobile Banking platform, which will be closed in six months, and BBNI expects the new app to help increase banking activity among the public in a more holistic way.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Reports 10.2 Trillion Rupiah New Contract, 37.4% YoY Decline
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya reported a new contract value of IDR 10.2 trillion for the first half of 2024, 37.4% below the 2024 target of IDR 37.4 trillion, achieving only 27.3% of the target. The result was driven by building projects (50% of the contract value), followed by water‑resource projects (32%) and the remainder from road and bridge, property, manufacturing and EPC projects.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Increases Stake to 61.75% After Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: PT Arthakencana Rayatama, the controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo (AKRA), purchased 15.9 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,595.4 per share between 28 June and 3 July 2024, for a total transaction value of approximately IDR 25.3 billion. After the transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama’s ownership in AKRA increased from 61.67% to 61.75%.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Seeks M&A Opportunities and Expands into EV Charging Business
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) corporate communications head Natalia Lusnita said the company is seeking merger and acquisition opportunities with businesses that have synergies with the group. She could not provide detailed information, but said the process is ongoing, with due‑diligence and a prudent approach. In addition, MPMX is expanding into the electric‑vehicle ecosystem through a new business line that will provide charging stations and battery‑swap services for electric vehicles.

tickerNews.title: Hillcon Sells 161.3 Million HILL Shares, Reducing Stake to 65.45%
tickerNews.content: Hillcon Equity Management, the controlling shareholder of Hillcon (HILL), sold 161.3 million HILL shares at an average price of IDR 2,300 per share on 2 July 2024, for a total transaction value of about IDR 371.1 billion. After the sale, Hillcon’s ownership in HILL fell from 61.93% to 65.45%.

tickerNews.title: TEBE Shareholder Hoch Ventures Sells Entire Stake
tickerNews.content: Hoch Ventures Pte. Ltd., a shareholder of TEBE, sold 106.7 million TEBE shares at IDR 500 per share on 14 June 2024, for a total proceeds of about IDR 53.4 billion. After the transaction, Hoch Ventures’ ownership in TEBE fell from 8.31% to zero.

tickerNews.title: ELPI Plans to Add Five New Barges Using 2024 Capex
tickerNews.content: Pelayaran Nasional Ekalya’s corporate secretary Wawan Heri Purnomo said the company plans to add five new barges through its subsidiary PT ELPI Nusantara Armada. The addition will use the 2024 capital expenditure allocation of IDR 1 trillion, with hand‑over of the vessels scheduled for the first half of 2025, after a nine‑month ordering lead time.
